text: <a href="../1-Samuel-16-1/" title="1 Samuel 16:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 And the LORD said unto Samuel, How long wilt thou mourn for Saul, seeing I have rejected him from reigning over Israel? fill thine horn with oil, and go, I will send thee to Jesse the Bethlehemite: for I have provided me a king among his sons.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-2/" title="1 Samuel 16:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And Samuel said, How can I go? if Saul hear *it*, he will kill me. And the LORD said, Take an heifer with thee, and say, I am come to sacrifice to the LORD.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-3/" title="1 Samuel 16:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will shew thee what thou shalt do: and thou shalt anoint unto me *him* whom I name unto thee.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-4/" title="1 Samuel 16:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And Samuel did that which the LORD spake, and came to Bethlehem. And the elders of the town trembled at his coming, and said, Comest thou peaceably?

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-5/" title="1 Samuel 16:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And he said, Peaceably: I am come to sacrifice unto the LORD: sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. And he sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-6/" title="1 Samuel 16:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And it came to pass, when they were come, that he looked on Eliab, and said, Surely the LORD'S anointed *is* before him.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-7/" title="1 Samuel 16:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 But the LORD said unto Samuel, Look not on his countenance, or on the height of his stature; because I have refused him: for *the LORD seeth* not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the LORD looketh on the heart.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-8/" title="1 Samuel 16:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. And he said, Neither hath the LORD chosen this.
<a href="../1-Samuel-16-9/" title="1 Samuel 16:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. And he said, Neither hath the LORD chosen this.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-10/" title="1 Samuel 16:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Again, Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. And Samuel said unto Jesse, The LORD hath not chosen these.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-11/" title="1 Samuel 16:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And Samuel said unto Jesse, Are here all *thy* children? And he said, There remaineth yet the youngest, and, behold, he keepeth the sheep. And Samuel said unto Jesse, Send and fetch him: for we will not sit down till he come hither.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-12/" title="1 Samuel 16:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And he sent, and brought him in. Now he *was* ruddy, *and* withal of a beautiful countenance, and goodly to look to. And the LORD said, Arise, anoint him: for this *is* he.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-13/" title="1 Samuel 16:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brethren: and the Spirit of the LORD came upon David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah.
<a href="../1-Samuel-16-14/" title="1 Samuel 16:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 But the Spirit of the LORD departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the LORD troubled him.
<a href="../1-Samuel-16-15/" title="1 Samuel 16:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And Saul's servants said unto him, Behold now, an evil spirit from God troubleth thee.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-16/" title="1 Samuel 16:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Let our lord now command thy servants, *which are* before thee, to seek out a man, *who is* a cunning player on an harp: and it shall come to pass, when the evil spirit from God is upon thee, that he shall play with his hand, and thou shalt be well.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-17/" title="1 Samuel 16:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And Saul said unto his servants, Provide me now a man that can play well, and bring *him* to me.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-18/" title="1 Samuel 16:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Then answered one of the servants, and said, Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite, *that is* cunning in playing, and a mighty valiant man, and a man of war, and prudent in matters, and a comely person, and the LORD *is* with him.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-19/" title="1 Samuel 16:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Wherefore Saul sent messengers unto Jesse, and said, Send me David thy son, which *is* with the sheep.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-20/" title="1 Samuel 16:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 And Jesse took an ass *laden* with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a kid, and sent *them* by David his son unto Saul.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-21/" title="1 Samuel 16:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And David came to Saul, and stood before him: and he loved him greatly; and he became his armourbearer.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-22/" title="1 Samuel 16:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 And Saul sent to Jesse, saying, Let David, I pray thee, stand before me; for he hath found favour in my sight.

<a href="../1-Samuel-16-23/" title="1 Samuel 16:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 And it came to pass, when the *evil* spirit from God was upon Saul, that David took an harp, and played with his hand: so Saul was refreshed, and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.
